caption.title: Simulations of lake stratification phenology across the Northern Hemisphere.
caption.p: Shown are the historic, averaged over all years from 1970 to 1999, spatial patterns in a the day of year of stratification onset, b the cold-season (November–April) average air temperature, and c the relationship between stratification onset, the cold–season air temperature, and wind speed. Also shown are the spatial patterns in d the day of year of stratification break-up, e the warm-season (May–October) average air temperature, and f the relationship between stratification break-up, the warm-season air temperature, and wind speed. All results are based on the average simulations across the lake–climate model ensemble.
